sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This compensation discussion and analysis explains our 2016 executive compensation program for the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program for the Companys NEOs also generally applies to the Companys other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please read this discussion and analysis together with the tables and related narrative about executive compensation which follow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Company Performance and CEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy has a strong pay for performance philosophy that contributed to very positive 2016 results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy achieved Company-record adjusted earnings* of $2.9 billion, adjusted earnings per share* of $6.19 and a 1-year TSR of 18.4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energys 2016 TSR outperformed the S&P 500 Utilities Index of 16.3% and the S&P 500 Index of 12.0% for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These accomplishments came as the Company continued to be a leader among the 10 largest U.S. utilities in substantially all financial metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the largest 10 U.S. utilities, NextEra Energy ranked #3 for 3-year TSR, #1 for 5-year TSR, #1 for 10-year TSR, #2 for 3-year adjusted earnings per share (EPS) growth and #1 for 5-year, 7-year and 10-year adjusted EPS growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, NextEra Energy ranked #1 among U.S. and global utility companies, based on market capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, NextEra Energy was named by Fortune Magazine as the Worlds Most Admired Electric & Gas Utility for the tenth time in the last eleven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in 2017, NextEra Energy was named by the Ethisphere Institute as one of the Worlds Most Ethical Companies for the tenth time in eleven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The returns that NextEra Energy generated for its shareholders were attributable to outstanding 2016 performance by the Companys two principal operating businesses, FPL and NextEra Energy Resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the Companys many operational and financial achievements in 2016 include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FPL:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achieved best-ever and top-decile performance in minutes of service unavailability per customer and best-ever average number of momentary interruptions per customer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued to have the lowest typical residential customer bill in Florida and customer bills that are about 25% below the national average;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: delivered best-in-class performance in per-customer operations & maintenance expense and top-decile overall fossil fleet generation availability of 93.4%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: won the JD Power award for highest residential customer satisfaction among large utilities in the South, and ranked 2nd in the nation among large utilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achieved top-decile residential and business customer satisfaction scores.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * This measure is not a financial measure calculated in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Appendix B to this proxy statement for a reconciliation of this non-GAAP financial measure to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ** Market capitalization is as of December 31, 2016; rankings are sourced from FactSet Research Systems Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy Resources:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued market leadership in North American wind generation, with 1,364 megawatts of wind generation capacity added, 1,287 megawatts of committed new wind origination and approved 1,597 megawatts, or $1.1 billion, of wind repowering projects;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: delivered strong performance in solar development, adding 981 megawatts of solar capacity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued successful execution of the Companys gas pipeline project construction program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achieved top-decile overall equivalent forced outage rate (EFOR) of 1.69%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ultimately, the Companys financial and operational performance is reflected in the increased value of its common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the following table illustrates, TSR over the three-year period from December 31, 2013 to December 31, 2016 was 53%, meaning that an investment of $100 in NextEra Energy common stock on December 31, 2013 was worth $152.61 on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEOs total direct compensation over the same period was well-aligned with TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our executive compensation program is designed to tie compensation to performance, some performance metrics on which our CEOs compensation is based are intentionally designed to result in value creation over an extended period of time as opposed to on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, CEO compensation may not precisely parallel TSR in any given period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation may lag corporate performance in certain years and it may outpace corporate performance in other years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although absolute alignment between pay and performance in each year may not be achieved and, in any event, may not be appropriate, the Compensation Committee believes that, over time, the Companys executive compensation program rewards superior performance, provides a disincentive for performance that falls short of expectations and closely aligns executive compensation with shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FUNDAMENTAL OBJECTIVE OF OUR COMPENSATION PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fundamental objective of our executive compensation program is to motivate and reward actions that the Compensation Committee believes will increase long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is designed to attract, retain, motivate, reward and develop high-quality, high-performing executive leadership whose talent and expertise should enable the Company to create long-term shareholder value that over time is superior to the shareholder value created by our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below highlights the fundamental elements of our executive compensation program that the Compensation Committee believes fulfills the core objective of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FUNDAMENTAL ELEMENTS OF OUR COMPENSATION PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail below, NEO direct compensation has three principal elements: base salary, annual incentive awards and equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BASE SALARY is a fixed amount of compensation that reflects the responsibilities and day-to-day contributions of NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNUAL INCENTIVE AWARDS are granted for achievement of a detailed set of key financial and operational performance measures, the majority of which are based on industry benchmarks and for which payouts depend on Company performance relative to those benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial measures are the Companys one-year adjusted earnings per share growth and adjusted return on equity compared to the ten-year average of the companies constituting the S&P 500 Utilities Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The operational measures are focused on operational performance relative to industry performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EQUITY COMPENSATION consists of performance share awards, performance-based restricted stock awards and non-qualified stock option awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards are granted for three-year performance periods to drive intermediate results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of performance share awards are based on three distinct measurements: (1) three-year TSR relative to companies in the S&P 500 Utilities Index; (2) three-year adjusted earnings per share growth and adjusted return on equity relative to the ten-year average of the companies comprising the S&P 500 Utilities Index; and (3) three-year average performance on core operational performance measures relative to industry peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based restricted stock awards vest ratably over three years only if the Company achieves a specified annual adjusted earnings goal each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-qualified stock option awards are granted subject to a three-year ratable vesting period, have a ten- year term and will deliver value to executives only if the Companys stock price at exercise exceeds the stock price on the grant date of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEY PRACTICES OF OUR COMPENSATION PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE SET TARGET TOTAL DIRECT COMPENSATION OPPORTUNITY AND PAY MIX TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF SHAREHOLDER VALUE CREATION AND EXECUTIVE RETENTIONEach NEOs 2016 target total direct compensation opportunity was set with reference to two groups of benchmarked companies, drawn from energy services and general industry, representing the broad competitive labor market from which we recruit executive talent and with which we must compete for that talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This target opportunity was then allocated over several forms of compensation, the mix of which was designed to support the goals of shareholder value creation and executive retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE LINK NEO FINANCIAL SUCCESS TO SHAREHOLDER VALUE CREATIONAll NEOs 2016 compensation included a significant element of equity compensation, supported by robust stock ownership guidelines, performance hurdles, vesting schedules and the potential for clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE VALUE, AND REVIEW, PERFORMANCE RELATIVE TO THE PERFORMANCE OF OUR COMPETITORS AND PEERS WHENEVER POSSIBLE, RATHER THAN RELATIVE TO ARBITRARY GOALSOur basic principle underlying the linkage between performance (both financial and operational) and executive compensation is that performance superior to our competition and peers will result in above-target compensation, while performance that is not superior to our competition and peers will result in below-target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wherever comparable industry information was available, our 2016 financial and operational performance goals were set, and our 2016 performance against those goals was measured, relative to industry performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL METRICS IN 2016 WERE ADJUSTED RETURN ON EQUITY AND ADJUSTED EARNINGS PER SHARE GROWTHThe principal financial metrics on which our 2016 results were benchmarked against industry performance were adjusted return on equity and adjusted earnings per share growth, both measured in comparison to the actual results of the other members of the S&P 500 Utilities Index over the 10-year period January 1, 2006 through December 31, 2016.* The Compensation Committee believes that these financial metrics are enduring standards, because they are objective, require the Company to demonstrate superior performance, are aligned with how shareholder value is created and encourage management to include stretch goals as part of the annual budget setting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that a 10-year period is appropriate for comparison due to the historically longer-term economic cycles inherent in the power industry and the sporadic volatility that the power industry experiences from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee accordingly believes that a 10-year period reduces the likelihood that, in any given year, inappropriate metrics will be established as a result of short-term industry anomalies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Estimated for 2016 using actual results for the first three quarters and analysts estimates for the fourth quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT WE DO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIE PAY TO PERFORMANCEA substantial majority of NEO pay is not guaranteed; 92% of the CEOs actual direct 2016 compensation was performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: USE INDUSTRY BENCHMARKS WHEN SETTING OPERATIONAL GOALS AND WHEN REVIEWING ACTUAL PERFORMANCE TO DETERMINE PAYOUTSWe generally target top decile or top quartile performance as compared to our industry on operational measures where benchmark data is available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual award payouts are driven by performance relative to industry rather than performance against arbitrary goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered performance superior to our industry will generally result in above-target compensation, while performance that is not superior to our industry will generally result in below-target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MITIGATE UNDUE RISKWe take steps to mitigate undue risks related to compensation, including using a clawback policy, stock ownership and retention requirements and multiple performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that none of the Companys compensation programs create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse impact on the Company, which the Committee validates through a review of a comprehensive risk assessment of incentive-based compensation plans each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROBUST STOCK OWNERSHIP GUIDELINESWe have robust stock ownership guidelines, which all NEOs exceed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOLDING PERIOD ON PERFORMANCE-BASED RESTRICTED STOCKWe require executive officers to hold performance-based restricted stock for 2 years after vesting (net of shares withheld for, or used to pay, taxes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MINIMUM FULL VESTING PERIOD FOR STOCK OPTIONS AND PERFORMANCE-BASED RESTRICTED STOCKStock options and performance-based restricted stock generally are granted with a minimum full vesting period of 3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANTThe Compensation Committee benefits from its use of an independent compensation consultant that provides no other services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER OUTREACH AND ASSESSMENT FOR IMPROVEMENTWe engage in shareholder outreach and regularly assess the executive compensation program against shareholder input, emerging trends and other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs REQUIRED TO ENTER INTO RULE 10b5-1 PLANS WITH MINIMUM WAITING PERIODS TO TRANSACT TRADES IN COMPANY SECURITIESCompany practice requires that NEOs must execute all trades pursuant to trading plans under SEC Rule 10b5-1 with specified minimum waiting periods approved by the General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT WE DO NOT DO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO CEO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO TAX GROSS-UPS OF NEO PERQUISITES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: materially amended change in control agreements have not included excise tax gross-up provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO REPRICING OF UNDERWATER STOCK OPTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO SHARE RECYCLING UNDER EQUITY COMPENSATION PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO HEDGING OF COMPANY SECURITIES BY NEOs OR DIRECTORS PERMITTED UNDER SECURITIES TRADING POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO PLEDGING OF COMPANY SECURITIESPledging of NextEra Energy securities as collateral is prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO GUARANTEED ANNUAL OR MULTI-YEAR BONUSES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 SAY-ON-PAY VOTE AND SHAREHOLDER OUTREACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we held our sixth annual advisory vote to approve NEO compensation, commonly known as say-on-pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we sought to engage with shareholders who in the aggregate represented a significant percentage of our outstanding shares, and held discussions with those who agreed to our request for engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those shareholders were generally supportive of our executive compensation program, and of our overall corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to making determinations about 2017 NEO total compensation opportunities, the Compensation Committee reviewed the results of the 2016 say-on-pay vote, noting that 95.0% of those voting had voted FOR the Companys compensation of ts NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered this vote to be supportive of the Companys executive compensation program and determined not to make any additional structural changes to the program for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE MADE 2016 COMPENSATION DECISIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee used its business judgment to set each NEOs target total direct compensation opportunity for 2016 and each compensation element.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee based its determination on its integrated assessment of a series of factors, including competitive alternatives, individual and team contribution and performance, corporate performance, complexity and importance of role and responsibilities, position tenure, leadership and growth potential and the relationship of the NEOs pay to the pay of NextEra Energys other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 36 of this proxy statement for a discussion of the Compensation Committees processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no material differences among NEOs with respect to the application of NextEra Energys compensation policies or the way in which total compensation opportunity is determined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resources
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee primarily used the following resources to aid in its determination of the 2016 target total direct compensation opportunity for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Comparisons/Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When establishing each NEOs target total direct compensation opportunity for 2016, the Compensation Committee considered the competitive market for comparable executives and compensation opportunities provided by comparable companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competition for executive talent primarily affects the aggregate level of the target total direct compensation opportunity available to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that it is critical to the Companys long-term performance to offer its executive officers compensation opportunities broadly commensurate with their competitive alternatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company obtained market comparison information for all NEOs from publicly-available peer group information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys peer group is composed of a set of companies from the energy services industry and a set of companies from general industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies were selected by the Compensation Committee with input from executive officers (including the chief executive officer) and the Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the use of companies both from the energy services industry and from general industry was appropriate because the Companys executive officers come both from within and from outside the Companys industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs were recruited from within and outside the Companys industry and the Committee believes that their opportunities for alternative employment are not limited to other energy or utility companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee conducted a review of the then-existing 2015 peer group based on the following criteria:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for Energy Services Industry Companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: publicly-traded companies with a strong United States domestic presence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: classified with a Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code similar to the Companys SIC cod
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual revenue greater than $1 billion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a potential source of executive talent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: included in an executive compensation survey database provided by a third party
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for General Industry Companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: publicly-traded companies with a strong United States domestic presence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: member of the Fortune 500
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: considered highly reputable and highly regarded for operational excellence, product/service leadership or customer experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: sustained revenues between 50% and 200% of the Companys revenues
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: fewer than 150,000 employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: heavily industrialized, highly regulated or a producer of consumer staples
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operate in industries which may be potential sources of executive talent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: no unusual executive pay arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: included in an executive compensation survey database provided by a third party
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contribute to diversity of industry representation in this segment of the peer group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Compensation Committee did not target specific total compensation levels relative to industry peers (a so- called percentile approach), it generally reviewed peer company data at the 50th percentile for the general industry companies and the 75th percentile for the energy services industry companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes these levels were appropriate because:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys practice is to make a relatively high portion of each NEOs compensation performance-based as compared to its peers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys operations are more complex, more diverse and of a greater size than those of substantially all of its energy services industry peer companies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys 2015 market capitalization and assets were above the 50th percentile of its general industry peer companies and above the 75th percentile of its energy services industry peer companies.

sentences.text: What We Use   How We Use It Tally sheets and walk-away charts   Provides a check to ensure that the Compensation Committee sees the full value of all elements of the NEOs annual compensation, both as opportunity and as actually realized, and sees the actual results of its compensation decisions in the various situations under which employment may terminate Reviews by the CEO   Prior to the beginning of the year, the Compensation Committee solicits performance reviews of the other NEOs and executive officers from the CEO for use as an additional input to the Committees determination of target total direct compensation opportunity and, after the end of the year, whether or not to use Committee discretion to adjust annual incentive compensation amounts determined using the formula discussed below
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 NEO PAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Pay Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy has three fundamental elements of total direct compensation: base salary, annual incentive awards and equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a significant portion of each NEOs total direct compensation opportunity should be performance-based, reflecting both upside and downside potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the proportion of total compensation that each compensation element constituted in 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed current market practices and industry trends, taking into consideration the Companys preference for emphasizing performance-based compensation and de-emphasizing fixed compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining performance- based compensation, the Compensation Committee sought to focus the efforts of the NEOs on a balance of short-term, intermediate-term and long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee considered the NEOs perception of the relative values of the various elements of compensation and sought input from the CEO and the Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated in the following charts, 89% of the CEOs 2016 target total direct compensation opportunity, and 75% of the other NEOs 2016 target total direct compensation opportunities, were performance-based and not guaranteed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO: For 2016, Mr. Robos base salary was increased by 4%, to $1,300,000 primarily reflecting the Companys superior operating results in 2015, the nature and responsibilities of Mr. Robos position, his expertise and performance, the competitiveness of his current pay in relation to his corresponding peer group and the business judgment of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEOs: Mr. Ketchums base salary in 2016 of $575,000 represented a 15% increase, Mr. Nazars base salary in 2016 of $874,200 represented a 4% increase, Mr. Pimentels base salary in 2016 of $838,100 represented a 6% increase and Mr. Silagys base salary in 2016 of $796,100 represented a 10% increase, all of which were based on the nature and responsibilities of their respective positions, their expertise and performance, the competitiveness of each NEOs current pay in relation to his corresponding peer group and the recommendations of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dewhurst did not receive a salary increase due to his retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also took into account the effect that base salary increases would have on other components of compensation, including annual incentive pay, long-term incentive plan grants and retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual Performance-Based Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of the Annual Incentive Plan for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Plan goals are established to incentivize superior performance relative to industry peers, and a majority of these goals are based on industry benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts under the Annual Incentive Plan are generally based on Company performance in the relevant period as compared to the benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the beginning of 2016, the Compensation Committee established financial and operational performance goals under the Annual Incentive Plan in the following categories:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Type of 2016 Performance Goals   How We Established and Used the 2016 Performance Goals Financial      The financial metrics are based on enduring standards indicative of sustained performanceadjusted earnings per share growth and adjusted return on equityas compared to the financial performance over the ten-year period ended on December 31, 2016 of the companies included in the S&P 500 Utilities Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Higher ratings indicate corporate financial performance superior to industry median and lower ratings indicate corporate financial performance which lags industry median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational      Operational goals and payout scales are established in advance of the year using available industry benchmarks insofar as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an industry benchmark is not available, the applicable goal generally is set at a level constituting an improvement or a stretch as compared to prior performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a general principle, the Compensation Committee seeks to set operational performance goals at levels that represent excellent performance, superior to the results of typical companies in our industry, and that require significant effort on the part of the executive team to achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance on certain compliance-related goals is scored as either met or not met, while performance against other goals is judged on a sliding scale in comparison to top decile, top quartile, median and sub- median performance as compared to the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Financial Performance Matrix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial performance matrix approved by the Compensation Committee for 2016, which is illustrated below, compares the Companys 2016 adjusted earnings per share growth and adjusted return on equity to the average of the actual annual earnings per share growth and return on equity of the companies included
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in the S&P 500 Utilities Index during the 10-year period from January 1, 2007 to December 31, 2016 (estimated for 2016 using actual results for the first three quarters and analysts estimates for the fourth quarter).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these financial metrics are enduring standards because they are objective, require the Company to demonstrate improvement, are aligned with how shareholder value is created and encourage management to include stretch goals as part of the annual budget setting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial performance matrix is designed to provide relatively greater rewards if the Company outperforms others in its industry on the indexed measures and relatively lower rewards if it does not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee based the matrix on adjusted earnings because t believes that adjusted earnings provide a more meaningful representation of the Companys fundamental earning power than net income calculated in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Committee believes that using adjusted earnings better aligns the NEOs motivations with the Companys strategy and with shareholders long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee believes that the use of adjusted earnings for this purpose is consistent with the way in which the Company communicates its earnings to analysts and investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The numbers in the following matrix set forth the range of possible ratings for corporate financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A rating of 1 indicates overall corporate financial performance at the industry median, while higher ratings indicate corporate financial performance superior to the industry median, and lower ratings indicate corporate financial performance which lags the industry median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important to recognize that the adjusted return on equity and adjusted earnings per share growth amounts set forth in the illustration below are not generated arbitrarily by the Company, but reflect actual industry performance on these measures for the 10-year period ended December 31, 2016, and that the Companys executive compensation is based, with respect to adjusted return on equity and adjusted earnings per share growth, on the performance delivered by the Company relative to industry performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Adjusted earnings per share and adjusted return on equity are not financial measurements calculated in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted earnings, as defined by NextEra Energy for purposes of the Annual Incentive Plan, are the Companys consolidated net income, as reported in the audited annual financial statements as determined in accordance with GAAP, excluding the effects of: (1) changes in the mark-to- market value of non-qualifying hedges; (2) other than temporary impairments on investments; (3) extraordinary items; (4) non-recurring charges or gains (e.g., restructuring charges and material litigation losses); (5) discontinued operations; (6) regulatory and/or legislative changes and/or changes in accounting principles; (7) labor union disruptions; and (8) acts of God such as hurricanes, which is used, among other reasons, to provide industry comparability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted return on equity, as defined by NextEra Energy, is equal to the Companys adjusted earnings divided by average common shareholders equity, adjusted to provide industry comparability, expressed as a percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted earnings per share, as defined by NextEra Energy, are equal to the Companys adjusted earnings divided by weighted average diluted shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Operational Goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees philosophy with respect to both setting and paying out incentives based on operational goals is that the goals set and the actual award payouts are driven by Company performance relative to industry benchmarks, rather than performance against arbitrary goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational goals and payout scales are established based on industry benchmarks and Company performance when meaningful benchmarks are available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted previously, delivered performance superior to our industry will generally result in above-target compensation, while performance that is not superior to our industry will generally result in below-target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that context, FPLs typical performance goals are generally equal to or better than the top quartile performers in its industry and NextEra Energy Resources targets earnings growth and profitability goals that are well above utility industry norms (in both cases based on internal reviews of publicly-available information and information provided by consultants and industry associations).

sentences.text: The following explains how the plan- adjusted amounts are calculated from NextEra Energys audited consolidated financial statements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) FPL operations & maintenance costs (plan-adjusted) is a measure that includes most but not all operations & maintenance expenses and includes certain expenses not classified as operations & maintenance expenses under GAAP, but reported for state regulatory purposes as operations & maintenance expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) FPL capital expenditures (plan-adjusted) are presented on an accrual basis, and exclude nuclear fuel payments and certain costs not classified as capital expenditures under GAAP in the consolidated statement of cash flows but reported for state regulatory purposes as capital expenditures; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) NextEra Energy Resources earnings (plan-adjusted) exclude
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the mark-to-market effect of non-qualifying hedges,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Fossil generation availability measures the amount of time during a given period that a power generating unit is available to produce power.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) The nuclear industry composite performance index referenced is the Institute of Nuclear Power Operations, or INPO, index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INPO promotes the highest levels of safety and reliability in the operation of commercial nuclear power plants by establishing performance objectives, criteria and guidelines for the nuclear power industry and conducting regular detailed evaluations of all nuclear power plants in North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The INPO index is an 18-month rolling average of a nuclear plants, and a companys nuclear fleets, performance against operating performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) OSHA is the United States Occupational Safety and Health Administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An OSHA recordable injury is an occupational injury or illness that requires medical treatment more than simple first aid and must be reported under OSHA regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) FERC is the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and NERC is the North American Electric Reliability Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) The equivalent forced outage rate is computed as the hours of unit failure (unplanned outage hours and equivalent unplanned de-rated hours) given as a percentage of the total hours of the availability of an electricity generating unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the end of 2016, the Executive Compensation Review Board (review board), whose members were Messrs. Ketchum, Pimentel, Robo and Silagy and the most senior human resources officer, assessed: (1) whether the operational performance goals had been achieved, exceeded or missed and, to the extent exceeded or missed, by what margin such goals had been exceeded or missed (as set forth in the tables above); (2) the degree of difficulty of achieving each goal; and (3) the Companys performance with respect to each goal as compared to the pre-established payout scale based on top decile, top quartile, median and sub-median performance on the same measure (industry-based where benchmark data was available), and arrived at an aggregate determination for the Companys 2016 performance as compared to the goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment determined that the Company had achieved superior performance in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The determination of the review board was then presented to the Compensation Committee, which had ultimate authority to accept or modify all or any part of the determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed and discussed the review boards recommendations and the conclusions on which they were based, and determined to accept those recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual Incentive Awards for the NEOs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEOs 2016 annual incentive compensation was determined based on a rating (NextEra Energy performance rating) derived by combining the Companys financial performance as measured by the financial performance matrix (weighted 50%) and the Companys operational performance as compared to the operational performance goals (weighted 50%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NextEra Energy performance rating for 2016, determined in this manner, was 1.82.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NextEra Energy performance rating may be adjusted for each NEO by the Compensation Committee based on individual performance under circumstances in which the Committee determines that the formulaic calculation of the performance rating without adjustment would otherwise result in the payment of an inappropriate incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally uses this aspect of the executive compensation program on a conservative basis, as it believes that the formula for calculating the NextEra Energy performance rating ordinarily should result in appropriate incentive payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individual performance adjustment, when used, historically has most often ranged between +/- 10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined the individual performance factors in 2016 based on recommendations from the CEO (for all of the NEOs other than himself).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each NEO other than the CEO, the 2016 individual performance factor was based primarily upon the Companys exceptional performance as described in the Executive Summary, above, as well as (for each NEO other than the CEO) the NEOs performance relative to a set of objectives agreed upon with the CEO at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the CEO, the Compensation Committee determined the individual performance factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined Mr. Robos 2016 individual performance factor based on the Committees assessment of his performance and the Companys overall 2016 performance as described in the Executive Summary above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following illustrates the determination of the 2016 annual incentive for each NEO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual incentive = (NextEra Energy performance rating x individual performance factor) x target annual incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance objective for performance-based restricted stock was increased substantially in 2013, from adjusted earnings of $500 million to adjusted earnings of $1.2 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the shares of performance-based restricted stock granted in 2016, which would otherwise vest ratably in 2017, 2018 and 2019, will not vest unless and until the Compensation Committee certifies that NextEra Energys adjusted earnings for 2017, 2018 and 2019, respectively, equal or exceed $1.2 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Compensation Committee intends for the grant date present value of performance-based restricted stock awards to equal the fair market value of an equivalent number of shares of the Companys common stock absent the performance and vesting conditions, dividends are paid on performance-based restricted stock awards as and when dividends are paid on the common stock.

sentences.text: Equity Grant Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards are granted by the Compensation Committee to the NEOs each year effective on the date of the Board meeting in mid-February, which is a date that is normally set two years in advance of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that granting equity in this way is appropriate because the Company typically releases year-end earnings in late January or early February, so all relevant information generally should be available to the market on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards may also be made to new executive officers upon hire or promotion, generally coincident with the date of hire or promotion or the Compensation Committee meeting next following the date of hire or promotion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not seek to time equity grants to take advantage of information, either positive or negative, about the Company which has not been publicly disseminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of options granted is equal to the closing market price of NextEra Energys common stock on the effective date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional 2016 Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy provides its executive officers with a comprehensive benefits program which includes health and welfare, life insurance and other personal benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For programs to which employees contribute premiums, executive officers pay the same premiums as other exempt employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement and other post-employment benefits are discussed below under Post-Employment Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are an integral part of the total compensation package for NEOs, and the aggregate value is included in the information reviewed by the Compensation Committee annually to ensure reasonableness and appropriateness of total rewards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, NextEra Energy believes that the intrinsic value placed on personal benefits by the NEOs is generally greater than the incremental cost of those benefits to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy provides its executive officers with personal benefits which, in many cases, improve efficiency by allowing the executive officers to focus on their critical job responsibilities and/or increasing the hours they can devote to work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of these benefits also serve to better secure the safety of the executive officers and their families.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and its Compensation Consultant periodically review the personal benefits offered by the Company to ensure that the program is competitive and producing the desired results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the benefits the Company derives from these personal benefits more than offset their incremental cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See footnote 2 to Table 1b: 2016 Supplemental All Other Compensation for a description of the personal benefits provided to the NEOs for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Company-Owned Aircraft
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company aircraft are available to the NEOs, as well as other employees and directors, for business travel, which includes, in the judgment of the Governance & Nominating Committee, travel by NEOs to Company-approved outside board meetings and travel in connection with physical examinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other advantages, business use of the aircraft by executives maximizes time efficiencies, provides a confidential environment for business discussions and enhances security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy permits limited non-business use of Company aircraft by NEOs when that use does not interfere with the use of Company aircraft for business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-business use is generally discouraged, however, and must be approved in advance by the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs must pay the Company for their non-business use based on the rate prescribed by the IRS for valuing non-commercial flights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A NEO traveling on Company aircraft for business purposes may, with the approval of the CEO, be accompanied by the NEOs guests, spouse and/or other family members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this circumstance, there is essentially no incremental cost to the Company associated with transporting the additional passengers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless travel is important to carrying out the business responsibilities of the NEO, however, the Company requires payment by the NEO for these passengers based on the rates described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-business use of Company aircraft is reported to and reviewed by the Governance & Nominating Committee annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the NEOs use of Company aircraft for non-business purposes represented approximately 111 passenger flight hours and for travel to Company-approved outside board meetings and annual physical examinations represented an additional approximately 14 passenger flight hours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company aircraft were used for a total of approximately 3,301 passenger flight hours in the aggregate in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy on Tax Reimbursements on Executive Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the NextEra Energy, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy on Tax Reimbursements on Executive Perquisites, the Company does not provide tax reimbursements on perquisites to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In circumstances where the Compensation Committee deems such an action appropriate, the Company may provide tax reimbursements to executives as part of a plan, policy or arrangement applicable to a broad base of management employees of the Company, such as a relocation or expatriate tax equalization policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR OTHER IMPORTANT COMPENSATION PRACTICES AND POLICIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership and Retention Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes it is important for executive officers to accumulate a significant amount of NextEra Energy common stock to align officers interests with those of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energys NEOs (and all other executives) are subject to a stock ownership policy and a stock retention policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes these policies strongly reinforce NextEra Energys executive compensation philosophy and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, the Company recognizes that the accumulation of a large, undiversified position in NextEra Energy common stock can at some point create undesired incentives, and it permits its officers some degree of diversification once the target level of holdings is reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the stock ownership policy, officers are expected, within three years after appointment to office, to own NextEra Energy common stock with a value equal to a multiple of their base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of NextEra Energy common stock and share units held in NextEra Energys employee benefit plans and deferred compensation plan are credited toward meeting this requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested shares of performance-based restricted stock count, while shares subject to unpaid performance share awards and unexercised options do not count, toward the calculation of required holdings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current multiples are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer      seven times base salary rate Senior Executive Officers      three times base salary rate Other Officers      one times base salary rate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all NEOs owned common stock in excess of their requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the stock retention policy, until such time as the requirements of the stock ownership policy are met, NextEra Energy expects executive officers to retain (and not sell) a number of shares equal to at least two-thirds of shares acquired through equity compensation awards (cumulatively, from the date of appointment as an executive officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with an amendment to the stock retention policy effective in March 2012, all of the NEOs (among other executive officers) must retain all shares of performance-based restricted stock which vest after March 16, 2012 for a minimum of 24 months after vesting (net of shares withheld for, or used to pay, taxes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers who fail to comply with the retention policy may not be eligible for future equity-based compensation awards for a two-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO may approve the modification or reduction of the minimum retention requirements (other than for himself) to address the special needs of a particular officer, although to date there have been no such modifications or reductions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, the Board adopted an incentive compensation recoupment, or clawback, policy which provides for recoupment of incentive compensation granted after the date the policy was adopted from current and former executive officers in the event of the occurrence of either of the following triggering events:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) a decision by the Audit Committee that recoupment is appropriate in connection with an accounting restatement of the Companys previously published financial statements caused by what the Audit Committee deems to be material non-compliance by the Company with any financial reporting requirement under the federal securities laws (Financial Statement Triggering Event); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) a decision by the Compensation Committee that one or more performance metrics used for determining previously paid incentive compensation was incorrectly calculated and, if calculated correctly, would have resulted in a lower payment to one or more executive officers (Performance Triggering Event).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a triggering event occurs, the Company will (to the extent permitted by applicable law) recoup from any executive officer any incentive compensation paid or granted during the 3-year period preceding the triggering event that was in excess of the amount that would have been paid or granted after giving effect, as applicable, to the accounting restatement that resulted from the Financial Statement Triggering Event or to what would have been the correct calculation of the performance metric(s) used in determining that a Performance Triggering Event had occurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive compensation to be recouped will be in an amount and form determined in the judgment of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the 2011 LTIP provides that any award granted under the 2011 LTIP will be subject to mandatory repayment by the grantee to the extent the events occur that require such mandatory repayment under
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) any Company clawback or recoupment policy that is adopted to comply with the requirements of any applicable law, rule or regulation, or otherwise (such as the policy described above) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) any law, rule or regulation which imposes mandatory recoupment upon the occurrence of such events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above under 2016 Long-Term Performance-Based Equity CompensationPerformance-Based Restricted Stock Granted in 2016, any dividends paid to the NEOs on performance-based restricted stock awards that do not vest must be repaid within 30 days following the forfeiture of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POST-EMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy expects continued and consistent high levels of individual performance from all executive officers as a condition of continued employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has in the past terminated the employment of executive officers who were unable to sustain the expected levels of performance, and it is prepared to do so in the future should that become necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs, including the CEO, are employees at will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below is a description of the agreements and programs that may provide for compensation should the NEOs employment with the Company terminate under specified circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NextEra Energy, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Severance Benefit Plan (the Severance Plan) provides for the payment of severance benefits to the NEOs and to certain other senior executives if their employment with the Company is involuntarily terminated in specified circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Severance Plan, which was adopted by the Compensation Committee in February 2013, is to retain the covered senior executives and encourage dedication to their duties by ensuring the equitable treatment of those who may experience an involuntary termination, as defined in the Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Plan provides severance benefits following involuntary termination in exchange for entry by the executive into a release of claims against the Company and an agreement to adhere to certain non-competition and related covenants protective of the Company and its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a covered involuntary termination and the execution of the release and other agreement, the executive would receive a cash payment equal to two times the executives annual base salary plus two times the executives target annual incentive compensation for the year of termination, payable in two equal annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the executives outstanding equity and equity-based awards would vest pro rata, and become payable at the end of any applicable performance periods, subject to the attainment by the Company of the specified performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive also would receive certain ancillary benefits, including outplacement assistance or payment in an amount equal to the value of the outplacement assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts payable under the Severance Plan are subject to a cap specified in the Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may amend or terminate the Severance Plan, in full or in part, at any time, but if an amendment or termination would affect the rights of an executive, the executive must agree in writing to the amendment or termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Plan does not provide for the payment of severance benefits upon terminations governed by the terms of the Retention Agreements described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the NEOs is a party to an executive retention employment agreement (Retention Agreement) with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded that the Retention Agreements are desirable in order to align NEO and shareholder interests under some unusual conditions, as well as useful and, in some cases, necessary to attract and retain senior executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with a change in control of the Company, it can be important to secure the dedicated attention of executive officers whose personal positions are at risk and who have other opportunities readily available to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By establishing compensation and benefits payable under various merger and acquisition scenarios, change in control agreements enable the NEOs to set aside personal financial and career objectives and focus on maximizing shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements also help the officer to maintain an objective and neutral perspective in analyzing opportunities that may arise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, they ensure continuity of the leadership team at a time when business continuity is of paramount concern.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without the Retention Agreements, the Company would have a greater risk of losing key executives in times of uncertainty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention Agreements entered into since 2009 do not include excise tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms of the Retention Agreements are described under Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Pension Plan and 401(k) Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy maintains two retirement plans which qualify for favorable tax treatment under the Code: a non- contributory defined benefit pension plan and a defined contribution 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans are available to substantially all NextEra Energy employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the NEOs participates in both plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension plan is more fully described following Table 5: Pension Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current tax laws place various limits on the benefits payable under tax-qualified retirement plans, such as NextEra Energys defined benefit pension plan and 401(k) plan, including a limit on the amount of annual compensation that can be taken into account when applying the plans benefit formulas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the retirement incomes provided to the NEOs by the qualified plans generally constitute a smaller percentage of final pay than is typically the case for other Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to make up for this and maintain the market-competitiveness of NextEra Energys executive retirement benefits, NextEra Energy maintains an unfunded, non-qualified SERP for its executive officers, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the NEOs, compensation included under the SERP is annual base salary plus the actual annual cash incentive award, as opposed to the compensation included under the qualified plans, which is annual base salary only.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy believes it is appropriate to include annual cash incentive awards for purposes of determining retirement plan benefits (both defined benefit pension and 401(k)) for the NEOs in order to ensure that the NEOs can replace in retirement a proportion of total compensation similar to that replaced by other employees participating in the Companys defined benefit pension and 401(k) plans, bearing in mind that base salary alone constitutes a relatively smaller percentage of a NEOs total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about the defined benefit plan benefit formulas under the SERP, see Table 5: Pension Benefits and accompanying descriptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy sponsors a non-qualified, unfunded Deferred Compensation Plan, which allows eligible highly compensated employees, including the NEOs, voluntarily and at their own risk to elect to defer certain forms of compensation prior to the compensation being earned and vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy makes this opportunity available to its highly compensated employees as a financial planning tool and an additional method to save for retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferrals by executive officers generally result in the Company deferring its obligation to make cash payments or issue shares of its common stock to those executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not view the Deferred Compensation Plan as providing executives with additional compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the Deferred Compensation Plan are general creditors of the Company and the deferral of the payment obligation provides a financial advantage to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nazar elected to defer 50% of his base salary in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX CONSIDERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee carefully considers the tax impact of the Companys compensation programs on NextEra Energy as well as on the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee believes that decisions regarding executive compensation should be primarily based on whether they result in positive long-term value for the Companys shareholders and other important stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Compensation Committee has considered the impact of tax provisions such as section 162(m) of the Code in structuring NextEra Energys executive compensation program and, to the extent reasonably possible in light of its compensation goals and objectives, the compensation paid to the NEOs has been structured with the expectation that it will qualify as qualified performance-based compensation deductible by the Company for federal income tax purposes under section 162(m) of the Code to the extent such section is applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in light of the competitive nature of the market for executive talent, the Compensation Committee believes that it is more important to ensure that the NEOs remain focused on building shareholder value than to use a particular compensation practice or structure solely to ensure tax deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, in some cases the compensation paid to NEOs is nondeductible, including in 2016, for example, a portion of Mr. Robos base salary, the value of certain of Mr. Robos personal benefits and the dividends accruing on his unvested performance-based restricted stock, which the Committee believes is appropriate, immaterial to the Company as a financial matter and consistent with the Companys overall executive compensation design and philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion & Analysis required by applicable SEC rules which precedes this Report and, based on its review and that discussion, the Committee recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion & Analysis set forth above be included in the Companys proxy statement for the 2017 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Respectfully submitted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kirk S. Hachigian, Chair Kenneth B. Dunn Amy B. Lane Rudy E. Schupp Hansel E. Tookes, II
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since many elements of total compensation are variable, based on performance and are not paid to the NEO for one, two or three years (and in some instances longer) after the compensation opportunity is first determined, the amounts reported in some of the tables in this proxy statement may reflect compensation decisions made prior to 2016 and in some cases reflect amounts different from the amounts that may ultimately be paid.

sentences.text: Additional Disclosure Related to Pension Benefits Table
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energy maintains two non-contributory defined benefit retirement plans: a tax-qualified employee pension plan and a non-qualified SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NextEra Energys tax-qualified employee pension plan is a cash balance plan in which credits to each active, full-time employees account are determined as a percentage of his or her monthly covered earnings, with basic crediting of 4.5% until the fifth anniversary of employment, and 6% thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Covered earnings for each NEO are limited to base salary and do not include annual incentive compensation, long-term incentive compensation or any other compensation included in Table 1a: 2016 Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each employees cash balance account is also credited quarterly with interest at an annual rate that is equal to the average yield on one-year Treasury Constant Maturities for the 12 months ending September 30 of the preceding calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * The interest crediting rate is subject to a 3% minimum for account balances earned after 2014 and a 4% minimum for account balances earned prior to 2015 and to a 14% maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the interest crediting rate was 4% for account balances earned prior to 2015 and 3% for account balances earned after 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the cash balance formula are not reduced for employer contributions to Social Security or other offset amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the qualified employee pension plan, benefits are cliff-vested after three full years of service and employees may become fully vested if they are participants in the qualified plan at a time when the Company decides to transfer a portion of pension plan assets to fund retiree medical benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs are fully vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All vested participants are eligible for lump sum payment of benefits following termination of employment, and certain annuity forms of payment are also available to all employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons described in Compensation Discussion & Analysis, NextEra Energy maintains an unfunded SERP for its executive officers, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERPs defined benefit formula for NEOs provides two times the normal cash balance crediting rate of the qualified employee pension plan (double basic credits).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The normal cash balance crediting rate is 4.5% prior to five years of service, and 6% thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double the basic crediting rate is therefore 9% and 12%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits for all NEOs are calculated in this manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to offset the benefits that Mr. Nazar forfeited from his prior employer in order to accept the Companys offer of employment, Mr. Nazar received an opening SERP cash balance account balance of $300,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, in order to offset the significant benefits that Mr. Pimentel forfeited from his prior employer in order to accept the Companys offer of employment, Mr. Pimentel received an opening SERP cash balance account balance of $150,000, and an additional $150,000 on each of his first and second anniversaries with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP benefits are cliff-vested after five full years of service and all NEOs were fully vested as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All vested participants are eligible for lump sum payment of benefits following termination of employment (subject to timing restrictions imposed by section 409A of the Code), or may elect certain annuity forms of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * As required under IRS regulations, effective Jan. 1, 2017, instead of using the average rates paid on the one-year Treasury Constant Maturities for the 12-month period ending Sept. 30 of the preceding calendar year, the Plan will use the average rates paid for the month of August of the preceding calendar year.
